Articles.Content:
So I, like every other excited kerbonaut who saw the announcement, downloaded the update as soon as I could, and went to play around with it this evening. Much to my dismay it decided to crash my computer. So I started it up again, and ran it again, and although my computer didn't die, the game did. I got this crash log: https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B5l4-NqSRpJoamw5UW80bEh3elk&usp=sharing

I tried a few other things, like switching in and out of 32bit mode from the launcher, fullscreen and windowed, that sort of thing. Got a bunch of other logs, they look the same to me. Let me know if you want them.

Thanks for making such a great game, even though it isn't really cooperating right now Hope you can help, I'm really excited for the new parts.

EDIT: I deleted and re-unzipped the compressed file, seems to be working okay. Think it was just a random failure of the unzippy software.

Edited November 10, 2015 by meatballcannon

Hi meatballcannon, can you please update your graphics driver and reboot, your logs are showing graphics driver issues.

d3d: failed to create cubemap id=1231 size=0 mips=1 d3dfmt=21 [invalid call]

Shader 'AtmosphereFromGround': fallback shader 'None' not found

Supplied NxActorDesc is not valid. createActor returns NULL.

Also, please try reinstalling KSP to C:\Games instead of Documents.

EDIT: I deleted and re-unzipped the compressed file, seems to be working okay. Think it was just a random failure of the unzippy software.

Great! So resolved?
